etymology.description: Unorthodox simplification: 卒(卒) (zú, "graduation") -> uses simplified components similar to 雑 from 雜
etymology.interpretation: 卆 is an unorthodox variant of 卒, likely created to simplify the writing by modifying components, akin to how 雑 simplified 雜. The basic semantic meaning tied to 'graduation' remains.

examples.chinese: 在卆之际他满怀期待(在卆之際他滿懷期待)，踏入新的人生阶段(踏入新的人生階段)。
examples.pinyin: Zài zú zhī jì tā mǎn huái qī dài, tà rù xīn de rén shēng jiē duàn。
examples.english: At graduation, he was full of anticipation, stepping into a new stage of life.

examples.chinese: 卆是人生的重要转折(卆是人生的重要轉折)。
examples.pinyin: Zú shì rén shēng de zhòng yào zhuǎn zhé。
examples.english: Graduation is an important turning point in life.

examples.chinese: 学校为卆举行了隆重的仪式(學校為卆舉行了隆重的儀式)，每位毕业生满载回忆(每位畢業生滿載回憶)。
examples.pinyin: Xué xiào wèi zú jǔ xíng le lóng zhòng de yí shì, měi wèi bì yè shēng mǎn zài huí yì。
examples.english: The school held a grand ceremony for graduation, and every graduate carried a wealth of memories.
